Title: Spin transport parameters of NbN thin films characterized by spin pumping experiments
Abstract: © 2019 American Physical Society.We present measurements of ferromagnetic resonance driven spin pumping and inverse spin Hall effect in NbN/Y3Fe5O12 (YIG) bilayers. A clear enhancement of the (effective) Gilbert damping constant of the thin-film YIG was observed due to the presence of the NbN spin sink. By varying the NbN thickness and employing spin-diffusion theory, we have estimated the room-temperature values of the spin-diffusion length and the spin Hall angle in NbN to be 14 nm and -1.1×10-2, respectively. Furthermore, we have determined the spin mixing conductance of the NbN/YIG interface to be 10nm-2. The experimental quantification of these spin transport parameters is an important step towards the development of superconducting spintronic devices involving NbN thin films.
